laazotea.indi.driver

Class INDIDriver

  • java.lang.Object
    • laazotea.indi.driver.INDIDriver
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    laazotea.indi.INDIProtocolParser
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    INDIDriverExample, INDIElTiempoDriver, INDIFilterWheelDriver, INDIFocuserDriver, RandomNumberGeneratorDriver

    public abstract class INDIDriver
extends java.lang.Object
implements laazotea.indi.INDIProtocolParser
    A class representing a Driver in the INDI Protocol. INDI Drivers should extend this class. It is in charge of stablishing the connection to the clients and parsing / formating any incoming / leaving messages.
    Version:
    1.34, November 6, 2013
    Author:
    S. Alonso (Zerjillo) [zerjioi at ugr.es]

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Modifier Constructor and Description
      protected INDIDriver(java.io.InputStream inputStream, java.io.OutputStream outputStream)
      Constructs a INDIDriver with a particular inputStream from which to read the incoming messages (from clients) and a outputStream to write the messages to the clients.

    • Constructor Detail

      • INDIDriver

        protected INDIDriver(java.io.InputStream inputStream,
          java.io.OutputStream outputStream)
        Constructs a INDIDriver with a particular inputStream from which to read the incoming messages (from clients) and a outputStream to write the messages to the clients.
        Parameters:
        inputStream - The stream from which to read messages.
        outputStream - The stream to which to write the messages.

    • Method Detail

      • registerSubdriver

        protected void registerSubdriver(INDIDriver driver)
        Registers a subdriver that may receive messages.
        Parameters:
        driver - The subdriver to register.

      • unregisterSubdriver

        protected void unregisterSubdriver(INDIDriver driver)
        Unregister a subdriver that may not receive any other message.
        Parameters:
        driver - The subdriver to unregister.

      • getName

        public abstract java.lang.String getName()
        Gets the name of the Driver.
        Returns:
        The name of the Driver.

      • startListening

        public void startListening()
        Starts listening to inputStream. It creates a new Thread to make the readings. Thus, the normal execution of the code is not stopped. This method is not usually called by the Driver itself but the encapsulating class (for example INDIDriverRunner).
        See Also:
        INDIDriverRunner

      • isStarted

        public boolean isStarted()
        Gets the started or not state of the Driver.
        Returns:
        true if the Driver has already started to listen to messages. false otherwise.

      • finishReader

        public void finishReader()
        Specified by:
        finishReader in interface laazotea.indi.INDIProtocolParser

      • getOut

        protected java.io.PrintWriter getOut()
        Gets the output PrintWriter.
        Returns:
        The output PrintWriter.

      • isConnected

        protected boolean isConnected()
        Checks if the CONNECTION Property is set to SwitchStatus.ON.
        Returns:
        true if the CONNECTION Property is set to SwitchStatus.ON. false otherwise.

      • parseXML

        public void parseXML(org.w3c.dom.Document doc)
        Parses the XML messages. Should not be called by particular Drivers.
        Specified by:
        parseXML in interface laazotea.indi.INDIProtocolParser
        Parameters:
        doc - the messages to be parsed.

      • processNewTextValue

        public abstract void processNewTextValue(INDITextProperty property,
                       java.util.Date timestamp,
                       INDITextElementAndValue[] elementsAndValues)
        Called when a new Text Vector message has been received from a Client. Must be implemented in Drivers to take care of the new values sent by clients. It will be called with correct Properties and Elements. Any incorrect Text Message received will be discarded and this method will not be called.
        Parameters:
        property - The Text Property asked to change.
        timestamp - The timestamp of the received message
        elementsAndValues - An array of pairs of Text Elements and its requested values to be parsed.

      • processNewSwitchValue

        public abstract void processNewSwitchValue(INDISwitchProperty property,
                         java.util.Date timestamp,
                         INDISwitchElementAndValue[] elementsAndValues)
        Called when a new Switch Vector message has been received from a Client. Must be implemented in Drivers to take care of the new values sent by clients. It will be called with correct Properties and Elements. Any incorrect Switch Message received will be discarded and this method will not be called.
        Parameters:
        property - The Switch Property asked to change.
        timestamp - The timestamp of the received message
        elementsAndValues - An array of pairs of Switch Elements and its requested values to be parsed.

      • processNewNumberValue

        public abstract void processNewNumberValue(INDINumberProperty property,
                         java.util.Date timestamp,
                         INDINumberElementAndValue[] elementsAndValues)
        Called when a new Number Vector message has been received from a Client. Must be implemented in Drivers to take care of the new values sent by clients. It will be called with correct Properties and Elements. Any incorrect Number Message received will be discarded and this method will not be called.
        Parameters:
        property - The Number Property asked to change.
        timestamp - The timestamp of the received message
        elementsAndValues - An array of pairs of Number Elements and its requested values to be parsed.

      • processNewBLOBValue

        public abstract void processNewBLOBValue(INDIBLOBProperty property,
                       java.util.Date timestamp,
                       INDIBLOBElementAndValue[] elementsAndValues)
        Called when a new BLOB Vector message has been received from a Client. Must be implemented in Drivers to take care of the new values sent by clients. It will be called with correct Properties and Elements. Any incorrect BLOB Message received will be discarded and this method will not be called.
        Parameters:
        property - The BLOB Property asked to change.
        timestamp - The timestamp of the received message
        elementsAndValues - An array of pairs of BLOB Elements and its requested values to be parsed.

      • sendAllProperties

        public void sendAllProperties()
        Sends all the properties to the clients.

      • propertiesRequested

        protected void propertiesRequested()
        This method is called when all the properties are requested. A driver with subdrivers may override it to be notified about this kind of requests (and ask the subdriver to also send the properties).

      • addProperty

        protected void addProperty(INDIProperty property)
        Adds a new Property to the Device. A message about it will be send to the clients. Drivers must call this method if they want to define a new Property.
        Parameters:
        property - The Property to be added.

      • addProperty

        protected void addProperty(INDIProperty property,
               java.lang.String message)
        Adds a new Property to the Device with a message to the client. A message about it will be send to the clients. Drivers must call this method if they want to define a new Property.
        Parameters:
        property - The Property to be added.
        message - The message to be sended to the clients with the definition message.

      • updateProperty

        protected void updateProperty(INDIProperty property)
                       throws laazotea.indi.INDIException
        Notifies the clients about the property and its values. Drivres must call this method when the values of the Elements of the property are updated in order to notify the clients.
        Parameters:
        property - The Property whose values have change and about which the clients must be notified.
        Throws:
        laazotea.indi.INDIException

      • updateProperty

        protected void updateProperty(INDIProperty property,
                  java.lang.String message)
                       throws laazotea.indi.INDIException
        Notifies the clients about the property and its values with an additional message. Drivres must call this method when the values of the Elements of the property are updated in order to notify the clients.
        Parameters:
        property - The Property whose values have change and about which the clients must be notified.
        message - The message to be sended to the clients with the udpate message.
        Throws:
        laazotea.indi.INDIException

      • removeProperty

        protected void removeProperty(INDIProperty property)
        Removes a Property from the Device. A XML message about it will be send to the clients. Drivers must call this method if they want to remove a Property.
        Parameters:
        property - The property to be removed

      • removeProperty

        protected void removeProperty(INDIProperty property,
                  java.lang.String message)
        Removes a Property from the Device with a message. A XML message about it will be send to the clients. Drivers must call this method if they want to remove a Property.
        Parameters:
        property - The property to be removed
        message - A message that will be included in the XML message to the client.

      • removeDevice

        protected void removeDevice(java.lang.String message)
        Removes the Device from the clients with a message. A XML message about it will be send to the clients. Drivers must call this method if they want to remove the entire device from the clients. It should be used if the Driver is ending.
        Parameters:
        message - The message to be sended to the clients. It can be null if there is nothing special to say.

      • getProperty

        protected INDIProperty getProperty(java.lang.String propertyName)
        Gets a Property of the Driver given its name.
        Parameters:
        propertyName - The name of the Property to be retrieved.
        Returns:
        The Property with propertyName name. null if there is no property with that name.

      • getConnectionProperty

        protected INDISwitchProperty getConnectionProperty()
        Gets the default Connection property (if the driver implements INDIConnectionHandler)
        Returns:
        The standard Connection property if this driver implements INDIConnectionHandler. null otherwise.

      • getPropertiesAsList

        public java.util.ArrayList<INDIProperty> getPropertiesAsList()
        Gets a list of all the Properties in the Driver.
        Returns:
        A List of all the Properties in the Driver.

      • printMessage

        public void printMessage(java.lang.String message)
        Write message to the INDI console (System.err)
        Parameters:
        message - The message to be printed.

      • getInputStream

        public java.io.InputStream getInputStream()
        Specified by:
        getInputStream in interface laazotea.indi.INDIProtocolParser

      • getOutputStream

        public java.io.OutputStream getOutputStream()
        Gets the OutputStream of the driver (useful for subdrivers).
        Returns:
        The OutputStream of the driver.

      • isBeingDestroyed

        public void isBeingDestroyed()
        A method that should be implemented when the driver is being destroyed to stop threads, kill sub-drivers, etc. By default it calls removeDevice.
        See Also:
        removeDevice(java.lang.String)
